poem.title: Zed
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: She said send for some bennies And sped. What she'd spend on them spelled D for zaster. Her nose bled. She stemmed it With the sleeve of my snazzy suede vest, which perhaps Smelled of something that caught her distraction. She tracked it Like a husky and sled. A whole team of them Swerved off the track. Swelled to a pack As dinner was served. Could I stay here instead?
